concept-wr.title: Centralized Log Collection and Analysis
concept-wr.shortdesc: You can configure Titanium Server to send detailed system logs from all hosts to a remote log server for centralized review and analysis.

conbody.p: You can also set up your own dashboards for viewing log details.

US77159 / US83068 new topicWhen centralized logging is enabled, logs written to the /var/log directory on each host are also sent to a remote log server. System logs used for troubleshooting and advanced analysis are included, along with the customer logs normally accessed from the CLI or web administration interface. By centralizing the logs, advanced users can apply powerful searches and advanced visualizations to examine the behavior of the system.

US80148 mention TLS option Each host sends logs through the Active Controller to a remote log server over the OAM network using either TCP or UDP. For added security, you can optionally configure a TLS connection. At the log server, an ELK (Elasticsearch, Kibana, Logstash) stack collects and presents the information.

The ELK stack is a widely-used source log analytics engine, with ample documentation and tutorials on the Internet. The Titanium Server SDK includes custom searches and filters for use with a Titanium Server system.
